title: cafter
author: cafter
created_time: October 11, 2023, 08:38:17 AMLast edit: October 11, 2023, 10:13:41 AM by cafter
content: Today I accidentally clicked on one of the signatures on this forum and went to roobet website and got a privacy error. After that, I tried other websites on signatures and got the same privacy error. I scanned my PC for viruses using windows security feature but it didn’t solve the issue either. I tried restarting my PC, I turned off content restriction from my router and browser, I tried changing DNS, but it still didn’t fix the issue.Here are all the images.I think every website has different privacy security errors.Read and help me fix this error if you have faced this type of error before.

comments.author: Latviand
comments.body: Is this your first time trying it on the Brave Browser? I think Brave actively blocks out websites they deem dangerous for your network or pc. Try using a different browser and see if there are any difference, if that doesn't happen then there's a possibility that it's an ISP thing and you might have to contact them.

comments.author: cafter
comments.body: Quote from: Latviand on October 11, 2023, 09:03:58 AMIs this your first time trying it on the Brave Browser? I think Brave actively blocks out websites they deem dangerous for your network or pc. Try using a different browser and see if there are any difference, if that doesn't happen then there's a possibility that it's an ISP thing and you might have to contact them.No, I Have 4 browsers installed in my pc and I tried in all of them, Brave, Chrome, Utopia's Idyll Browser, Tor. But I am still facing this issue. It was started from today until yesterday all was running fine. and from yesterday I have not changed any settings or not have done anything related to this.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: I believe it's because your local ISP block those sites, it's nothing new when you're come from a country where gambling is illegal. You can't access stake.com, I will suggest you to try all of the other mirror links from this site https://playstake.io/, let's see what you got. I don't think your browser is the problem except you intentionally restrict those sites.

comments.author: Tuturtinular
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on October 11, 2023, 08:38:17 AMToday I accidentally clicked on one of the signatures on this forum and went to roobet website and got a privacy error. After that, I tried other websites on signatures and got the same privacy error. I scanned my PC for viruses using windows security feature but it didn’t solve the issue either. I tried restarting my PC, I turned off content restriction from my router and browser, I tried changing DNS, but it still didn’t fix the issue.~snip~Does your country prohibit gambling activities? Maybe your internet network is blocking access to the Roobet site so you get a notification like that when you visit that address. My country prohibits gambling activities so I have often seen things like that. Try using a VPN from a country where gambling is legal, it usually works fineIf you have used a VPN and are still experiencing the same error, perhaps the Roobet site is experiencing problems or may be undergoing repairs.Edit:I tried visiting the Roobet site using Singapore VPN and everything seemed fine

comments.author: cafter
comments.body: Quote from: Tuturtinular on October 11, 2023, 09:17:53 AMSnipI tried using vpn of USA and it works fine, My country has no prohibition towards online gambling. But don't know why I am facing this issue.I tried all the things I written in the OP. Is there anything else which I am missing? My windows update is ongoing for now, I will update this thread after a restart...... and also I have asked to other indian members that they are also facing this issue or not waiting for reply.....

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Check these instructions for this error there is not one reason why you have that connection it could be the time of your computer is not synched or your operating system is not updated I had this issue before and the culprit is the time in my computer is not sync.https://www.avast.com/c-your-connection-is-not-private

comments.author: piebeyb
comments.body: I've actually experienced a problem like this, but I usually do the DNS settings and then I can access it again, but you have done the DNS settings but still can't access it, actually you can find out first what the cause is, it could be that your ISP is blocking you, try using it. Can a VPN access it, if it can, it means your ISP is blocking gambling sites.Another way you can detect it is by using your cell phone browser with the same ISP as your computer. If it can be accessed on your cell phone but not on the computer, it means there is a problem with your computer, sometimes clock problems on the computer often also make the security display like that or maybe you are using private browsing from brave browser, try using another browser and make sure it is updated, hopefully your problem can be solved, I'm just saying it's not a virus

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: First of all, I think this post does not belong in the gambling board, but rather, it should be in the meta board, this is a forum related issue for you, and has nothing to do with gambling, so please consider moving this thread to the Meta board if you don't mind.Secondly and now back to your issue, I am currently typing from my pc and I've visited all the sites you mentioned on your thread from the signatures on this forum, and they all opened without any type or kind of issue, so this should prove that your issue is probably from your pc or internet service provider, unfortunately, i do not know the type pc you use, the provider that provide internet connection for you, all I can say is, if you think your pc internet settings are ok as it should be, consider reaching out to your internet provider and table to issue before them, if the issue is from their end, i believe they will find a fix to it immediately.meanwhile, goodluck.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on October 11, 2023, 09:25:59 AMI tried using vpn of USA and it works fine, My country has no prohibition towards online gambling. But don't know why I am facing this issue.I tried all the things I written in the OP. Is there anything else which I am missing? My windows update is ongoing for now, I will update this thread after a restart...... and also I have asked to other indian members that they are also facing this issue or not waiting for reply.....Have you tried checking if there is any new anti-virus that was installed recently in your system or activated only in your browser? Because most of the time, some anti-virus programmes block some specific sites from being accessed in your system unless you authorise it. Or it could also be as a result of your PC location being changed by some third-party app, where the current location might appear to be in a gambling-restricted location, as it appears to work anytime you connect a VPN to the system and change your location. After the window update, if the issue still continues, I will advise you to run some diagnostics on your PC to see if there is any recent change that was done on your PC, either by you unknowingly or by a third-party app. I guess that might also help.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on October 11, 2023, 09:25:59 AMI tried using vpn of USA and it works fine, My country has no prohibition towards online gambling. But don't know why I am facing this issue.I tried all the things I written in the OP. Is there anything else which I am missing? My windows update is ongoing for now, I will update this thread after a restart...... and also I have asked to other indian members that they are also facing this issue or not waiting for reply.....If you tried VPN and it works, and you are using one of your country's internet service provider, that means they are the ones that is causing it. You can try to access the gambling sites on another device and see if it would work. The issue is strange to me and I have never seen it before which might make me not have information about it.

comments.author: cafter
comments.created_time: October 11, 2023, 09:46:47 AMLast edit: October 11, 2023, 09:58:45 AM by cafter
comments.body: Update: I did a Network Reset in Windows, which is at the bottom of the network settings, and now I'm not getting that error and all the sites are working fine. This issue can sometimes be related to Browser DNS settings, where there are a lot of DNS options, such as google DNS, open DNS, cloudfare DNS, etc. Most of these DNS settings prohibit adult content, such as porn and gambling sites. If you're facing this issue in the future, you should also check your Browser DNS settings.

comments.author: edmundduke
comments.body: Ive had this happen before. The first time it cleared itself when i unplugged everything overnight, the second time i did a dns flush/reset and fixed it right up. Its good that you added this thread with images btw, im guessing there will be more people who will experience the same

comments.author: libert19
comments.body: It's browser related thing and happens on mobile browsers too, I'm not sure if it's exactly DNS related as I'd usually restart the browser and it would work fine.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: edmundduke on October 11, 2023, 10:01:53 AMIve had this happen before. The first time it cleared itself when i unplugged everything overnight, the second time i did a dns flush/reset and fixed it right up. Its good that you added this thread with images btw, im guessing there will be more people who will experience the same The fact that the thread is here does not mean that it will stay here forever, and what i mean by "here" is the first page of this board, most especially in this gambling board where threads with no activity easily gets buried in the background.And yes, people will surely encounter this same problem and even some other problems as long as it has to do with the internet, but the good news actually is that, solutions are scattered all over the internet, not just on this forum.For example, a google search of OP's problem would turn up tens of thousands of different websites with solutions, even though we know that some of this sites are not genuine, some are malware infected and so on.All the same, I am happy that Op already found a solution, and have managed to put the issue behind him, I sure have learnt how he did was able to fix this issue, just incase i myself encounter same issue some day for whatever reason.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on October 11, 2023, 09:46:47 AMUpdate: I did a Network Reset in Windows, which is at the bottom of the network settings, and now I'm not getting that error and all the sites are working fine. This issue can sometimes be related to Browser DNS settings, where there are a lot of DNS options, such as google DNS, open DNS, cloudfare DNS, etc. Most of these DNS settings prohibit adult content, such as porn and gambling sites. If you're facing this issue in the future, you should also check your Browser DNS settings.This is nice to hear. It can be frustrating if a gambler is not able to access all the gambling sites that he is using. It is good that you can access the gambling sites again. But I will advice you to lock this thread because you have solved the issue.
